docs.snippet: The Grand Lodge of the United States, I. O. O. F., representing the great Brotherhood of Odd Fellows of the United States, yesterday commenced the holding of their annual sessions at the Odd Fellows' Hall, Baltimore. The body received the report of...

headline.main: A Year's History of the Odd Fellows.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Grand Lodge of the United States, I. O. O. F., representing the great Brotherhood of Odd Fellows of the United States, yesterday commenced the holding of their annual sessions at the Odd Fellows' Hall, Baltimore. The body received the report of the Committee on Credentials; and, after this, heard the report of the Grand Secretary, which, after some preliminary matters, gives the condition of the Order throughout the jurisdiction of the Grand Lodge.

docs.snippet: The Educational Convention which assembled here during the present week, net in Ely's Hall, on Tuesday, Sept. 14, at 2 o'clock, P.M., and was called to order by the President, the Hon. H. H. VAN DYCK, Superintendent of Public Instruction. At the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Educational Convention which assembled here during the present week, net in Ely's Hall, on Tuesday, Sept. 14, at 2 o'clock, P.M., and was called to order by the President, the Hon. H. H. VAN DYCK, Superintendent of Public Instruction. At the first roll-call thirty-eight District Commissioners and City Superintendents answered to their names.

headline.main: ST. PETERSBURG.; M. Lesseps at Odessa--The Suez Canal--The Imperial Library at Pavloski--A Droshky Described--Cost of Living at the Russian Capital--The Markets.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Journal d'Odessa gives some particulars of the reception in that city of M. FERDINAND DE LESSEPS, the projector of the Suez Canal, which, in view of the wide-spread notoriety of the subject, and the stand which several nations have taken with regard to the plan, are not without importance and significance. In describing the ovation to M. DE LESSEPS, the Journal remarks:

docs.snippet: Yesterday, at 11 A. M., the investigation into the charge preferred by Gen. NYE against Mr. F. A. TALLMADGE, General Superintendent of Police, for neglect of duty in failing to send a posse of Police to repress the incendiarism at Staten Island, was...

headline.main: Gen. Tallmadge on Trial.; FURTHER EVIDENCE BEFORE THE POLICE COMMISSIONERS.

docs.lead_paragraph: Yesterday, at 11 A. M., the investigation into the charge preferred by Gen. NYE against Mr. F. A. TALLMADGE, General Superintendent of Police, for neglect of duty in failing to send a posse of Police to repress the incendiarism at Staten Island, was resumed before the Police Commissioners, all of whom, with the exception of Mayor POWELL and Mayor TIEMANN, were promptly in attendance.

docs.snippet: FATAL ACCIDENT.--JOHN LUNNIGAN, a boy 17 years old, was almost instantly killed, yesterday morning, by being run over on tile Long Island Railroad, near the Depot, in Atlantic-street. The deceased was on his way to New-York, and was about to cross...
docs.lead_paragraph: FATAL ACCIDENT.--JOHN LUNNIGAN, a boy 17 years old, was almost instantly killed, yesterday morning, by being run over on tile Long Island Railroad, near the Depot, in Atlantic-street. The deceased was on his way to New-York, and was about to cross the track as a train of cars which had been detached from the locomotive was passing from the funnel into the depot.

headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; Magnetic Telegraph Company's Offices--No. 43 Wall-street and Astor House. EUROPE. ADVICES THREE DAYS LATER ARRIVAL OF THE NIAGRA AT HALIFAX, CONDITION OF THE ATLANTIC CABLE ARRIVAL OF THE CHINESE TREATIES. INTERESTING FROM INDIA AND CHINA [By the American Telegraph Company's Lines office No. 21 Wall-st.]

docs.lead_paragraph: The royal mail steamship Niagara, Capt. MILLER, left Liverpool at 10 1/2 A. M. of the 11th, and arrived at Halifax on the morning of Wednesday, 22d. She reports having had good weather. Sept 11, at 21/2 P.M., passed the Arabia, from New-York, bound in. The steamers City of Washington and Nova Scotian arrived at Liverpool on the evening of the 9th.

docs.snippet: The steamship Niagara, of the Cunard line, from Liverpool on the 11th inst. for Boston, called at Halifax early yesterday morning. Her news is not important. Nothing further in regard to the Atlantic Cable has transpired, though from the fact that...
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Niagara, of the Cunard line, from Liverpool on the 11th inst. for Boston, called at Halifax early yesterday morning. Her news is not important. Nothing further in regard to the Atlantic Cable has transpired, though from the fact that the shipment of the heavy shore ends from Plymouth has been countermanded, it is to be presumed the directors regard the accident as serious.

headline.main: OVER LAND TO CALIFORNIA.; Notes of an Overland Journey from Salt Lake to San Francisco.

docs.lead_paragraph: My brief letter of the 5th inst. announced my arrival at this point by the Overland Mail route from Great Salt Lake City, but did not give any detailed account of the trip such as may be of interest at least to those who contemplate a journey over land. I propose now to supply the omission. We left the Mormon Zion on Monday morning,

docs.snippet: By the arrival of the North Briton at Quebec, and of the Northern Light at this port, we have intelligence from England to the 8th inst. The news, so far as the Atlantic Cable is concerned, is important. On the 6th, it was announced in London that...
docs.lead_paragraph: By the arrival of the North Briton at Quebec, and of the Northern Light at this port, we have intelligence from England to the 8th inst. The news, so far as the Atlantic Cable is concerned, is important. On the 6th, it was announced in London that the signals had ceased-an announcement which at once causes a decline of the shares to [pound]400 and [pound]500 as the nominal quotations, without sales.
